cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi SSW of Tampa Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northward along the west coast of Florida, turning N-NE on Wednesday and then accelerating northeastward across the Southeast U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Steinhatchee River / Big Bend area of north-central Florida

weather_observation.watch_coast: No tropical storm or hurricane watch in effect for Tampa Bay; surge watch begins west of Aucilla River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Egmont Key (mouth of Tampa Bay) to Steinhatchee River; Storm Surge Warning Bonita Beach to Aucilla River including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida from Bonita Beach through Tampa Bay northward to the Big Bend
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40-60 mph) beginning Tuesday night with a brief window of hurricane-force gusts possible around daybreak Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rises of 3–5 ft above ground level possible in Tampa Bay, including Port Manatee
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with localized totals to 9 inches could cause flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents that may hinder vessel movements and port operations
